title: 109_hr4518
content: The "Congressional Anti-Corruption Act of 2005" may be cited as the short title. It includes a provision for the forfeiture of retirement benefits. Section 8312(a) of title 5, United States Code is amended to include a new provision for individuals convicted of specific offenses. Offenses described in subsection (d) will result in the forfeiture of retirement benefits. Section 8312(a) of title 5, United States Code is amended to include a provision for forfeiture of retirement benefits for individuals convicted of specific offenses listed in subsection (d). The offenses must fall under certain sections of title 18 and be committed by covered officials defined as the President, Members of Congress, and heads of Executive departments. The term 'covered official' includes specific government positions as outlined in the legislation. Section 8312(a) of title 5, United States Code is amended to include forfeiture of retirement benefits for individuals convicted of specified offenses. Section 8313(a)(1) is amended to include offenses after the enactment of subsection (d) of section 8312. Section 8316(b) is amended regarding nonaccrual of interest on refunds. Title 5 is amended to include forfeiture of retirement benefits for individuals convicted of specified offenses, including those described in section 8312(d). SEC. 3. INCREASED PENALTIES FOR CERTAIN CORRUPTION-RELATED OFFENSES. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to increase penalties for corruption-related offenses, including doubling the maximum prison terms for various offenses such as bribery and theft. Title 18, United States Code, amended to double maximum prison terms for corruption-related offenses, including bribery and theft. Title 18, United States Code has been amended to increase prison terms for corruption-related offenses. A person convicted of specific offenses listed in the code is permanently disqualified from acting as a lobbyist.
